meanings.definition: The act of illegally recruiting or coercing people, especially Pacific Islanders, to work as laborers.
meanings.sent1: Blackbirding is a serious crime that exploits vulnerable workers.
meanings.sent2: The history books are filled with stories of blackbirding in the Pacific Islands.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed the villains as engaging in blackbirding to fill their plantations with workers.
meanings.sent4: The sinister practice of blackbirding still haunts the memories of many Pacific Islanders.
meanings.sent5: The dark shadow of blackbirding looms over the history of labor exploitation.

meanings.definition: The practice of kidnapping or tricking individuals into forced labor.
meanings.sent1: Many innocent people fell victim to the cruel act of blackbirding.
meanings.sent2: The authorities worked tirelessly to put an end to the illegal blackbirding operations.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show joked about a clumsy gang attempting blackbirding but failing hilariously.
meanings.sent4: The concept of blackbirding is a stark reminder of the inhumanity that exists in the world.
meanings.sent5: The novel vividly described the horrors of blackbirding through the eyes of a young victim.
